subject: Football's Back
event:
The NFL is back... and the Giants kicked off the season with a convincing win over the Washington Redskins.  Eli and the offense sputtered a bit after a strong start, settling for field goals three times, but other than that it was a good performance on both sides of the ball.  Plaxico Burress and Brandon Jacobs looked like beasts.  I did think the playcalling got a little too conservative in the second half, but a win is a win, especially against a division foe.

Based on what I saw last night, it's going to be a long season for fans of the Potomac Drainage Basin Indiginous Persons.

Now let's see how Brett and the new Jets do against Chad and the Fins on Sunday.

(I really really wish Chad hadn't ended up on the Fins.)

props.current_music: Are You Ready for Some Football?

comments.article: Glad Eli is my backup on my fantasy team, and not my primary quarterback (Brees), that's all I have to say.

I don't do Fantasy. I'm a Real fan... :). I used to play, but then I realized that I was never going to enjoy rooting for opposing players.

Lots of talking heads are picking New Orleans to be serious Super Bowl contention so you may have something there. But, Eli has Plax and that's all I have to say.

TMQ fan, eh?

I don't have a good feeling about this season, but that might be because the only thing our #1A wide receiver has done this offseason was to legally change his last name to a mangled Spanish translation of his jersey number.

Actually it's not mangled at all: 'Ocho Cinco' is literally 'Eight Five'.

'though it would've been better if he picked 'Ochenta-y-cinco' ('Eighty Five') but it doesn't have the same ring to it now duzzit? ;)

You and me both.

I kept saying not the Jets Not the Jets Not the Jets but did TPTB listen to me? No!

I am not expecting much from them this year.
comments.subject: Re; Chad

comments.article:
So glad I have Eli and Plaxico on my Fantasy Team. Individually their performances would not have generated many points, but together... a placed with a wide lead over my first opponent.

Keeping fingers crossed that the O-line and WRs can give Brett what he needs to work his magic.
The tuna has them back on track.  I love the pick up of Pennington for a young team.  I can smell the upset and Favre throwing two picks to the dolphins underrated secondary.
comments.subject: Dolphins on Sunday

comments.upictitle: The Greatest Fucking Genius of All Time: villain
comments.article: I loved Eli's touchdown right in the beginning of the game, but after the first quarter, it got a little boring.

Nice to see another Wolverine around.

Did Henne end up making it to the NFL? Whereabouts is he?

Aw that was a GREAT game last night. Coughlin always gets conservative towards the end of a game when they are winning. I suppose it's better to be conservative than to give up a game from a stupid play or interception late when you are ahead. That opening drive was spectaculare though. Sure made me feel better after all the blathering from sports experts saying last year was just a fluke. If it was a fluke well then I hope they fluke it again!

I'm really looking forward to see Brett Favre and Chad Pennington go head to head this weekend. I think the irony or well if not irony then at least sweet sweet coincidence of it all is just funny.
Does Coughlin make play by play calls? I thought that he didn't.

Ahh, so you read TMQ as well, eh?

But the best NFL site out there, imho, is footballoutsiders.com
comments.subject: Potomac Drainage Basin Indigenous Persons

comments.article: Sputtering won't matter if they still win, of course. I remember the Ravens making it on defense one year, much to my chagrin as a lifetime Cleveland fan.:-)
ADWD or it didn't happen.
comments.subject: ADWD

comments.article: The game did get a little boring, but it was still good to see actual regular season football! Can't wait until Sunday, and the inevitable sick day call on Monday Morning!

I said it before and I'll say it again.  As a Fins fan (I refuse to call myself a Dolphan - uuuugh), I've got a certain amount of cautious optimism about Pennington at the helm of my team.  I've got no real problem with Favre, but I hope he goes down in flames this weekend and I get to see Ricky Williams punch in three touchdowns, with the third followed by his ascension into the heavens, carried by aqua-clad cherubim.
comments.subject: Giants Loss...

comments.article: Oh, I will still read your books, but I think it is awful that the evil NY Giants beat the beloved Redskins. Yeah, DC should change the name of their team, it's pretty racist. At least Washington didn't suffer a total blowout, I was kind of impressed with how close it was.

The G-Men need to clean up that kick coverage on special teams. Rueben Droughns was a pretty good special teamer this preseason, but he was on the inactive list for this game. Maybe by the next game the Giants won't have two roster spots devoted to kickers and it will allow them enough flexibility with the roster to possibly activate Droughns.

And this is the reason the G-Men need to keep David Tyree when he comes off the PUP list. Catch 42 was awesome, but Jints fans know that he's also our best special teamer. Heck, he went to the Pro Bowl one year for his play on special teams.

A win is a win though, and they have three extra days to address the rough spots. Go G-Men!

True... It's the first time the staff and the team plays a full game, so they really don't know exactly what they have or lack. The staff needs to get better at preparing for and calling a complete game.
Give Zorn a chance!

Wow.  I finally broke down and created a LiveJournal account in order to post a comment.  My 21-year-old daughter will be proud of me.  One of my best friends is a Giants fan, and so is my favorite author, and our local "dead-skins" deserved the loss last night, but I have to say none of them are Potomac Drainage Basin "Indiginous" Persons.  (By the way, I think you meant "indigenous"?)  I've lived in the Potomac drainage basin for 42 of the last 46 years and I'm not sure I'm an indigenous person here, but I can bet I'm closer than those NFL players and our Seattle import coach.  Anyway, I'm not a huge Giants fan, but WTG to your team.  And I'll be watching those Jets since they drafted Tennessee's Eric Ainge -- go Vols!  What a hoot--caught my favorite author in a spelling error.  That game must have excited you!
comments.subject: Potomac Drainage Basin "Indiginous" Persons

comments.article:
It doesn't surprise me that the Giants beat the redskins. A giant is, like, 20 feet tall, after all, and he's got allot more hits than a guy wearing only a leather loin-cloth. Of course, you never know what a giant is going to do next...

So what is this Foot ball you guys are talking about again?
comments.subject: The Game

comments.article: If you don't know, it's a preview of what's in the next book. Apparently Tyrion is in yet another duel by Foot Ball. I'm surprised you haven't heard. ;)
comments.subject: Re: The Game

comments.upictitle: Matthew S. Rotundo: Me with bird
comments.article:
(I really really wish Chad hadn't ended up on the Fins.)

Ah, but this Fins fan is quite happy about that. Best move I've seen from the Fish in a while.

Giants looked pretty good, especially the first half. Although Eli was lucky to have only one interception. There was about two or three that should have been picks with coverage/defense guys of the Redskins letting them go right off their hands. If I remember correctly, Campbell had one that should have been a easy pick as well, but nowhere the number Eli lucked out on. Otherwise, pretty good pass-rush against the 'skins which I really think was the key to their making it and winning the Superbowl.

I hear you George on your Jets vs fins game, ever since I got Pennington on a autopick draft on Fantasy my first year back around 2004, I've had a soft spot for the kid. He doesn't have a big arm, but he made up for it in just about every other aspect and the rotator cup injuries really took him out of the game, and now to get replaced by Favre and traded and have to play the Jets on his Miami debut...it's a cold, hard NFL. Although at least he found work and gets to start, hope he has a good year over their under Parcell's new would/could-be flagship.

However, this Sunday - go Cowboys!

I didn't have a dog in that fight, except Burress on my fantasy squad who racked up some points for me.

I did, however, love watching Brandon Jacobs just running over people and Clinton Portis, on his blocking plays knocking folks off their feet.

Beware of Eli in fantasy play. Very inconsistent.
comments.subject: Smash Mouth Football

comments.article:
I'm not sure if I'd consider a 16-7 win convincing, but it's as you say - it's a win and against a divisional rival with a stout defense. The Redskins are the NFC equivalent of the Raiders - you might not score more than 20 points against their defense, but not to worry: their offense probably won't put up more than 10 points of their own. Then again, maybe the Raiders will find some offense this year with JaMarcus and McFadden.

Fins lucked out with Old Chad. Two years is the perfect amount of time to groom New Chad and give Old Chad a better shot than he was getting from Mangini. I firmly believe the Fins will start the Parcells Era with a win.

Now to see how my hometown Lions do this season... I'm holding out hope, but I do that every season and ultimately end up disappointed and slightly bitter.

Well the fact is, regardless of Parcells, the fins are still a fairly terrible team and I expect the more talented to Jets to steam roll to victory.

As for the Giants, I would be surprised to see them really win many games with a margin of more than 2 td's. With Osi and Strahan gone we aren't going to see Quarterbacks being intimidated as much this season. So if a team manages to get ahead I wouldn't be surprised to see that old Eli making bad decisions while trying to make a play come back.
I hope you can get Guillermo Navarro (Pan's Labrynth, Hellboy, Desperado and more) to do this as a film. I just saw him speak and discuss his approach to cinematography and was so impressed!
comments.subject: When Ice & Fire becomes a Movie

comments.article: As it's an HBO project, they could package the DVD's as a double-feature with the Carnivale series.
comments.subject: Re: When Ice & Fire becomes a Movie
